Framework

Customization

Replace the HTML

# Replacing the HTML Templates

To replace the default HTML templates, you can create a `.html` file with the same naming convention as the component file. For example, if you have a `popup.tsx` and would like to override the HTML, create a `popup.html` file:

popup.html

```nx-border-black nx-border-opacity-[0.04] nx-bg-opacity-[0.03] nx-bg-black nx-break-words nx-rounded-md nx-border nx-py-0.5 nx-px-[.25em] nx-text-[.9em] dark:nx-border-white/10 dark:nx-bg-white/10
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <title>__plasmo_static_index_title__</title>
    <meta charset="utf-8" />
  </head>
  <body></body>
</html>
```

If you have a `popup/index.tsx` file, create a `popup/index.html` file with content similar to the above.

ðŸ‘€

You do not need to include the root element or the script tag. The Plasmo
Framework will handle that for you.

[Use src Directory](https://docs.plasmo.com/framework/customization/src "Use src Directory") [Alias Imports](https://docs.plasmo.com/framework/customization/alias "Alias Imports")
